intro: Koenigia lichiangensis, commonly known as the Yunnan ice plant, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand harsh, dry conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study. Koenigia lichiangensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in specialized gardens.
